[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Document Editing System (DES) defines requirements for managing documents, sheets, and graphical objects.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DES supports document creation, text formatting, and graphical editing.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DES integrates with storage services, cloud sync, and printing solutions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DES provides text input, formatting, and graphical manipulation features.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DES supports touchscreens, styluses, and keyboards.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DES uses PDF.js, SVG.js, and Fabric.js for document rendering.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DES secures data via encryption and user authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DES is optimized for handling large documents efficiently.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DES manages text, images, and geometric objects.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DES is configurable for different user needs and workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DES connects with cloud storage, printing services, and collaboration platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DES supports document editing, text formatting, and graphics manipulation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DES is designed for editors, designers, and general users.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DES requires stable storage for large files.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DES relies on standard file formats, input methods, and cloud connectivity.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Document: A file containing sheets for text and graphics management.
Sheet: A document section for text and graphics.
Geometric Object: A graphical element such as a circle, rectangle, or line.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall manage document text, formatting, and graphical objects (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track modifications and layout changes (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall integrate with cloud storage for synchronization (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to create, edit, format, and save documents (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support adding, modifying, and moving geometric objects and text, including cut, copy, paste, and duplication (REQ-DB-002, REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive user interface for document editing.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process text, formatting, and graphics updates within 1 second.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store text, formatting, and document history.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track graphical objects and layers.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall manage cloud synchronization and storage metadata.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce unique identification for each document.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with document format and storage standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain logs for editing operations and sync events.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate document editing, graphical object manipulation, and cloud synchronization.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and storage policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Document format standards, cloud storage policies, and API specifications.
